speaker: her
text: They will be upon our track by this time,

speaker: Jefferson Hope
text: Everything depends upon our speed. Once safe in Carson we may rest for the remainder of our lives.

speaker: Lucy Ferrier
text: You are mad to come here,

speaker: Hope
text: It is as much as my own life is worth to be seen talking with you. There is a warrant against you from the Holy Four for assisting the Ferriers away.

speaker: Hope
text: I don't fear them, or their warrant,

speaker: Hope
text: You must know something of this matter, Cowper. I conjure you by everything you hold dear to answer a few questions. We have always been friends. For God's sake, don't refuse to answer me.

speaker: Hope
text: Be quick. The very rocks have ears and the trees eyes.

speaker: Hope
text: What has become of Lucy Ferrier?

speaker: Hope
text: She was married yesterday to young Drebber. Hold up, man, hold up, you have no life left in you.

speaker: Jefferson Hope
text: Married yesterday--that's what those flags are for on the Endowment House. There was some words between young Drebber and young Stangerson as to which was to have her. They'd both been in the party that followed them, and Stangerson had shot her father, which seemed to give him the best claim; but when they argued it out in council, Drebber's party was the stronger, so the Prophet gave her over to him. No one won't have her very long though, for I saw death in her face yesterday. She is more like a ghost than a woman. Are you off, then?

speaker: her
text: She shall not be buried in that,
